What is/are your favorite video game(s)? they can be on any console, online or not. Just want to see people's favorites.

 Star Wars Galaxies (online) (PC)

Warcraft 3

Kill.Switch

A classic would be the old pitfall on the Atari.

 When I rate games until PS1 I'd say that all the Konami Games for the NES and SNES were fantastic.

Perfect Dark for 64 was the best... I'd really like them make a newer one.
 Just started Final Fantasy Ten... Never played a FF game before.
 Diablo II expansion is alrght.
I really don't have much patience for video games but I do enjoy the occasional bout of Snood.

Alpha Centaury (they just need to upgrade their AI)
 
 Civilization (Not as good a graphics setup as Alpha Centary and a bit more linear, more predictable)
 
 Age of Empires derivations (For the continuous game, rather than turn-based as the above)
 
 (The above are all strategy games, which gives a lot more flexibility and personal touch to a game than just the shoot-them-up linear games.)

OK I KNOW THAT PEOPLE ARE READING THIS WHY AREN'T YOU REPLIEING AM I THE ONLY GAMER/ANIME FAN 
 
 
 hmm maybr I am..

Best Games? Hmm, by system I think it would have to fall like this:
 (I realize many of these games were originally arcade, but Im listing them as they come to mind)
 NES: Kirby's Dreamland, Megaman 2 or 3, and FFII
 SNES: Zelda: Link to the Past (This game never gets old), Chronotrigger, Ogrebattle, Super Metroid, Sunset Riders, Super Mario RPG, Killer Instinct, and UMK3.
 N64: (this system really blows) Goldeneye, i guess
 PSX: FF7 and Rival Schools
 PS2: Soul Caliber II and FFX 
 Arcade: Marvel Super Heroes (and any of the "vs." fighting game franchise esp. Marvel Super Heroes vs. Street Fighter), DDR, and the Metal Slug Series.
 PC: Lemmings, Space Quest Series, Kings Quest Series, Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis, Prisoner of Ice, Broken Sword I and II, Return to Zork, original Doom and Quake, and The Incredible Machine (I know I'm an adventure freak and that most of these games date back 5-10 years).
 If I think of any more, I'll post them.

My best game on the computer would have to be either Star Wars Force Commander or X-Wing Alliance. Both fairly old games, I know - but they are still very fun to play. Both games are multi-player and can be played on-line - if you have quite a lot of money. I sometimes play X-Wing Alliance on the network against my friends to whom I slaughter.
I almost forgot to mention Castlevania: Symphony of the Night for PSX. This game gives me several joygasms everytime I play.

I'm shocked that no one has mentioned Dance Dance Revolution (DDR) yet. This is one of the few games that can get you to lose weight and become more active while being very entertaining and fun. Before playing this game myself I would have called it a joke and would have felt stupid playing it. Now that I've been playing it for about six months I have to say there is no game I would rather find myself playing a year from now than DDR.
